subject: p18322589
History: Intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure, evaluate for interval change.
Findings: One portable AP semi-erect view of the chest. Severe pulmonary edema is unchanged. Bilateral pleural effusions are unchanged. Moderate cardiomegaly is stable. There is no evidence of pneumothorax. Sternotomy wires and mitral valve hardware are in appropriate position. Right atrial transvenous pacer lead still passes posteriorly in the right atrium ending at the inferior cavoatrial junction, a nonstandard position. The right ventricular lead is in appropriate position.
Impression: Unchanged severe pulmonary edema. Bilateral pleural effusions are unchanged. Right atrial lead still ends at the inferior cavoatrial junction.
